emails.subject: Edge in consumer discretionary - alternative data
emails.body_text:
{{first_name}},

I'll keep this brief - I know your time is valuable.

We've built an alternative data platform that gives institutional investors a 14-day advance read on consumer sentiment shifts.

The thesis: Consumer reviews are the canary in the coal mine. When customers start complaining about wait times, portion sizes, or service quality, same-store sales follow 2-4 weeks later.

We track 500k+ locations across restaurants, retail, and hospitality. Our signals have shown 67% accuracy with a 1.8 Sharpe over the past 6 months.

Funds like {{company_name}} that run consumer discretionary exposure could use this as a leading indicator for position sizing and timing.

Is alternative data sourcing something you'd delegate to your team, or would you want to see a quick overview first?

Simon
Founder, ReviewSignal.ai

emails.subject: Re: Consumer sentiment data - quick example
emails.body_text:
{{first_name}},

One quick example of our signals in action:

September 2025 - Chipotle (CMG)

Our system detected:
• 23% sentiment drop in TX/CA locations
• Complaints about portion sizes up 3x
• Review velocity up 40% (more negative reviews)

This was 18 days before earnings.

Result: CMG dropped 8% post-earnings on "unexpected" same-store sales miss.

The data was there. Most investors just weren't looking at it.

If this kind of signal would be useful for your team, I can arrange a brief walkthrough.

Simon
